title: Zashboard recipes
text: Write mtcars CSV point minimal spec , build static HTML.
code: library(zashboard) csv <- tempfile(fileext = ".csv") write.csv(mtcars, csv, row.names = FALSE)  spec <- list(   title = "CSV → Static demo",   datasets = list(     cars = list(type = "csv", path = csv)   ),   charts = list(     list(id = "mpg_by_cyl", title = "Average MPG by cylinders",          type = "bar", dataset = "cars", x = "cyl", y = "mean(mpg)")   ),   layout = list(rows = c("mpg_by_cyl")),   theme = list(bootswatch = "cosmo") )  out_dir <- zashboard::build_static(spec = spec, overwrite = TRUE) browseURL(file.path(out_dir, "index.html"))

title: Zashboard recipes
code: library(zashboard); library(DBI); library(duckdb) con <- DBI::dbConnect(duckdb::duckdb()) on.exit(DBI::dbDisconnect(con, shutdown = TRUE), add = TRUE) DBI::dbWriteTable(con, "mtcars", mtcars, overwrite = TRUE) res <- zashboard::zashboard_execute_sql(list(type="duckdb", handle=con),   "SELECT cyl, AVG(mpg) AS avg_mpg FROM mtcars GROUP BY cyl ORDER BY cyl;") head(res)  spec <- system.file("examples/mtcars/mtcars.yml", package="zashboard", mustWork=TRUE) app <- zashboard::build_shiny(spec = spec) # shiny::runApp(app)

title: Zashboard recipes
code: library(zashboard); library(arrow) pq <- file.path(tempdir(), "mtcars.parquet") arrow::write_parquet(mtcars, pq) dir <- zashboard::build_shinylive(overwrite = TRUE) list.files(dir) file.edit(file.path(dir, "app.json")) browseURL(file.path(dir, "index.html"))

title: Build Dashboards from One Spec as Static HTML, Shiny, or Shinylive
text: minimal, practical example using built-mtcars data. builds four targets: static HTML, Shiny app, Shinylive, Quarto project. Tip: render Quarto site locally, set render_quarto = TRUE, run quarto::quarto_render($quarto_dir) installing Quarto.
code: library(zashboard)  # 1) Use the packaged example spec spec <- system.file("examples/mtcars/mtcars.yml", package = "zashboard", mustWork = TRUE)  # 2) Build all targets (skip Quarto rendering by default for speed) out <- build_all(spec = spec, overwrite = TRUE, render_quarto = FALSE) out  # 3) What you get: # - Static:     file.path(out$static_dir,    "index.html") # - Shinylive:  file.path(out$shinylive_dir, "index.html")  # + app.json # - Quarto:     file.path(out$quarto_dir,    c("_quarto.yml", "index.qmd")) # - Shiny app:  out$shiny_app   # a shiny.appobj (run via shiny::runApp(out$shiny_app))  # Open the static dashboard in your browser browseURL(file.path(out$static_dir, "index.html"))

title: Zashboard V1 Spec (Working Copy)
text: Define one dashboard spec build four targets : Static HTML (safe interactivity offline hosting) Shiny app (full interactivity, cross-filtering) Shinylive app (browser-executed Shiny via WebAssembly) Quarto site (literate site wrapper + docs around dashboard; uses spec)

title: Zashboard V1 Spec (Working Copy)
text: One spec drives outputs (forked authoring). Data layer: local analytics via DuckDB Arrow; Microsoft SQL Server supported via DBI/ODBC. Cross-filtering: supported Shiny; static builds use safe, non-executable interactivity. Theming: unified via bslib across targets. Optional AI MCP (Model Context Protocol): default; enabled explicitly. Industrial-grade v1: clarity, tests, CI, docs, reproducibility.

title: Zashboard V1 Spec (Working Copy)
text: CHECKLIST.md — V1 scope checklist. ✅ (present) inst/templates/zashboard.yml — minimal spec template. ✅ (present) scripts/build_static.R — outline static build pipeline. ✅ (present) www/ — runtime assets (service worker, client loader, etc.). ✅ (present) SPEC.md — file (working copy synced PDF). ✅ (now) ZIP contains additional schema files (e.g., manifest schema), add/align land.

title: Zashboard V1 Spec (Working Copy)
text: data sources (DuckDB/Arrow, SQL Server via DBI/ODBC), datasets (tables, joins/relationships), measures/aggregations, visuals (type, mappings, filters), layout, theme tokens (bslib), routes. Static HTML: pre-aggregated data artifacts, safe client interactions (server). Shiny: server-backed cross-filtering drill behaviors. Shinylive: Shiny browser, honoring spec. Quarto: site wrapper + docs; renders _site/ locally docs/ CI Pages. Theming: single theme map (bslib) applied consistently. Caching & performance: local DuckDB/Arrow caching; pushdown SQL Server appropriate. Accessibility: sensible aria labels, color-contrast defaults, keyboard navigability core components. Config toggles: AI/MCP features opt-; never auto-enable ship secrets.

title: Zashboard V1 Spec (Working Copy)
text: Full Power BI/DAX parity. Hosted service / multi-tenant sharing features. Complex row-level security (basic filters okay; full RLS deferred).

title: Zashboard V1 Spec (Working Copy)
